Register to Vote
It takes less than 5 minutes to register to vote
Why Register to Vote?
Registering to vote gives you the power to have a say in important decisions that affect your community and country.
How to Register to Vote
The quickest and easiest way to register is online.
It only takes 5 minutes. Visit Register to Vote and follow the simple instructions by clicking on the register button shown.
If you prefer to register by post, you can find the instructions on the website as well.
Online Registration
When you register online, you’ll need to provide your name, address, date of birth, and National Insurance number (but you can still register if you do not have one). It’s a quick and straightforward process.
After Registration
After you’ve registered, your name and address will appear on the electoral register.
Don’t Miss Out on Your Chance to Vote!
Registering to vote is important and easy. Don’t miss out on the opportunity to make your voice heard. Register today!

Manifesto for Noor Jahan Begum – Independent Candidate for Ilford South
As your independent candidate, I am committed to addressing the most pressing issues affecting our community and society at large. My vision is one where fairness, equality, and justice are at the forefront of our collective progress. I pledge to tirelessly and passionately advocate for the following priorities:
1. More Funding for the NHS
The NHS stands as a beacon of equality, embodying the principle that healthcare is a universal right, not a privilege. We all understand the peace of mind that comes from knowing we can see a GP or specialist when needed, regardless of our social or economic background. Increased funding is essential to maintain and enhance this vital service. By ensuring central government allocates more resources to the NHS, we can guarantee that it continues to save lives and uphold the dignity of every individual in our community.
2. Tackle the Cost of Living Crisis
The escalating cost of living has plunged too many families into poverty. It is unacceptable that hard-working people are forced to sacrifice basic necessities to provide proper meals for their children. The proliferation of food banks, now a lifeline for many, highlights the urgency of this crisis. I will fight for policies that reduce living costs and provide tangible support to struggling families, ensuring that no one has to choose between heating their home and feeding their family.
3. More Policing for Safer Neighbourhoods
Safety is a fundamental right. Our neighbourhood police officers play a crucial role in making life safer and better for everyone. They provide the confidence and peace of mind needed to live our lives without fear. I will advocate for increased funding and support for our police force to ensure they have the resources necessary to protect and serve our communities effectively.
4. Social Justice and Human Rights
True progress is inclusive, and often measured by the way in which we protect the most vulnerable in our community. I am dedicated to promoting social justice and safeguarding human rights for all. This means fighting against discrimination, ensuring equal opportunities, and upholding the dignity of every individual, regardless of their ethnic, religious or social background. I passionately believe that by fostering a society that values and respects diversity and individuals, we can build a stronger, more cohesive community.
5. Affordable Housing
Housing is a basic human need, yet too many are struggling to afford a place to live. I will champion policies that increase the availability of affordable housing, ensuring that everyone has access to safe and decent accommodation. This includes supporting initiatives that promote sustainable development and protect tenants’ rights.
6. More Inclusive Education
Education is the foundation of a successful, progressive society. An inclusive education system that caters to the diverse needs of all students is essential for fostering a society where everyone can thrive. I will push for policies that support equal access to quality education, ensuring that every child has the opportunity to succeed, regardless of their circumstances. An increased investment in education will also develop essential skills by our younger generation; unleashing skills and talents which are valuable for the individual and society overall, to allow for meaningful participation in civil society and political life. I will support initiatives which supports adult learning and training for the workplace.
7. Support the Rights of the Palestinian People
The catastrophe facing the Palestinian people is a defining global justice issue of our time. As global citizens, it is our duty to stand up for justice and human rights everywhere, whether on our doorstep or further afield. I pledge to work with agencies and challenge the government, to support the rights of the Palestinian people, advocating for a peaceful and just resolution to their plight. By promoting dialogue, understanding, and compassion, we can contribute to a more equitable and peaceful world.Together, we can build a community and a society that reflects our shared values of fairness, equality, and justice. With your support, I will work tirelessly to turn these pledges into reality.
8. Supporting Local Business
I stand for prosperity for all withing our community and will advocate for greater support local business to create opportunities for growth and expansion of enterprise. I support initiatives which will bring thriving high streets and business hubs that will reinvigorate Ilford South both economically and socially.
Nationally
I support investment in public services, in particular the NHS, schools, and the criminal justice system. I support electoral reform, an end to arms sales to countries involved in civilian killings, and rapid action on the climate crisis. In addition I support reform of party political funding and curtailing the influence of large corporations on public policy
Locally
I have been vocal on the urgency of the need to add a new wing to King George’s Hospital to increase capacity, called for a review of development plans for 1280 homes in Goodmayes Tesco site. I have expressed the need for rapid repairs to the Broadmead Road bridge in Woodford Green, closed by Redbridge Council due to safety concerns, and advocate for urban renewal of the Ilford Town and Ilford Lane area. I have stated my opposition to over development without adequate investment in infrastructure and to the closure of local resources. I have also been advocating for greater consultation of stakeholders particularly parents and a further review of plans to convert Park Girls into a school for children with special educational needs.
For a more detailed outline of my vision for Ilford South please refer to the following downloadable document.
Vote for Noor Jahan, and let’s create a future we can all be proud of!

At Noor4IlfordSouth campaign (NC) we are committed to protecting the privacy and
security of your personal information. This privacy notice outlines how we collect,
use, and safeguard your personal data in accordance with the General Data
Protection Regulation (GDPR) and the Data Protection Act 2018.
- Information We Collect
We may collect and process the following types of personal information:
- Contact Information: Names, addresses, email addresses, and phone numbers.
- Demographic Information: Age, gender, and other relevant demographic details.
- Communication Preferences: Your preferences regarding how we communicate
with you. - Professional Information: Resume/CV, cover letter, employment history,
qualifications, skills, and references. - Sensitive Information: Information about disabilities or health conditions relevant to
the job, if applicable. - Other: any other personal information provided voluntarily by you when you register,
sign up for events, subscribe to our newsletters, or as part of our Volunteer
Management processes. - Non-personal information: such as browser type, operating system, and IP
address for website analytics.
- How We Use Your Information
Most of the personal information we process is provided to us directly by you. We
use your personal information for the following purposes:
- Communication: To keep you informed about our activities, events, and initiatives.
- Volunteer Management: If applicable, to manage volunteers and their contributions
in particular: - To assess your suitability for a position you may have applied for.
- To communicate with you about the volunteer application process.
- To verify your information and carry out background checks, where
applicable. - To comply with legal or regulatory requirements.
- Fundraising: If applicable, to seek your support for fundraising activities.
- Analyse: website usage and improve our content, provide and personalise our
services.
- Legal Basis for Processing
Under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), the lawful bases we rely on
for processing this information are:
Noor4IlfordSouth Campaign
(a) Your consent. You are able to remove your consent at any time. You
can do this by contacting [email protected]
(b) We have a legitimate interest.
(c) We have a legal obligation.
- Data Sharing
In certain instances, we may share your data with trusted third-party organisations to
support volunteer management and fundraising objectives. This will be done in strict
compliance with applicable data protection laws.
- Data Security
We take the security of your personal information seriously and have implemented
measures to protect it from unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration, and
destruction. We will not hold your personal data for any longer than is required. In
most instances this will not exceed two years. We will dispose of this information
securely, either by deleting it (erasure) or by anonymising it, so that it is no longer in a
form which permits identification of data subjects.
- Cookies
We use cookies to enhance your browsing experience. You can set your browser to
refuse cookies, but this may limit some features on our website.
- Links to Other Websites
Our website may contain links to other websites. We are not responsible for the
privacy practices of these sites and encourage you to review their privacy policies.
- Your Rights
Under data protection law, you have rights including:
Your right of access – You have the right to ask us for copies of your personal
information.
Your right to rectification – You have the right to ask us to rectify personal
information you think is inaccurate. You also have the right to ask us to complete
information you think is incomplete.
Your right to erasure – You have the right to ask us to erase your personal
information in certain circumstances.
Your right to restriction of processing – You have the right to ask us to restrict the
processing of your personal information in certain circumstances.
Your right to object to processing – You have the the right to object to the
processing of your personal information in certain circumstances.
Noor4IlfordSouth Campaign
Your right to data portability – You have the right to ask that we transfer the
personal information you gave us to another organisation, or to you, in certain
circumstances.
You are not required to pay any charge for exercising your rights. If you make a
request, we have one month to respond to you.
- Contact Information
If you have any questions, concerns, or requests regarding the processing of your
personal information, please contact: [email protected]
- Changes to the Privacy Notice
We may update this privacy notice periodically. We will notify you of any significant
changes by posting the updated statement on our website.
Thank you for being a part of Noor4IlfordSouth and contributing to the strength and
vibrancy of our community.
Noor4IlfordSouth Campaign
Last Updated 20th May 2024

Restricted access
Access to certain areas of our website is restricted. We reserve the right to restrict access to other areas of our website, or indeed our whole website, at our discretion.
If [we provide you with / you generate] a user ID and password to enable you to access restricted areas of our website or other content or services, you must ensure that the password is kept confidential.
You must notify us in writing immediately if you become aware of any unauthorised use of your account or password.

You must not use any other person’s user ID and password to access our website, unless you have that person’s express permission to do so.
We may disable your user ID and password at any time in our sole discretion with or without notice or explanation.
User content
In these terms of use, “your content” means material (including, without limitation, text, images, audio material, video material and audio-visual material) that you submit to our website, for whatever purpose.

Notwithstanding our rights under these terms of use in relation to your content, we do not undertake to monitor the submission of such content to, or the publication of such content on, our website.
Limited warranties
We do not warrant the completeness or accuracy of the information published on this website; nor do we commit to ensuring that the website remains available or that the material on the website is kept up to date.
To the maximum extent permitted by applicable law, we exclude all representations, warranties and conditions relating to this website and the use of this website (including, without limitation, any warranties implied by law in respect of satisfactory quality, fitness for purpose and/or the use of reasonable care and skill).
Limitations and exclusions of liability
Nothing in these terms of use will: (a) limit or exclude our or your liability for death or personal injury resulting from negligence; (b) limit or exclude our or your liability for fraud or fraudulent misrepresentation; (c) limit any of our or your liabilities in any way that is not permitted under applicable law; or (d) exclude any of our or your liabilities that may not be excluded under applicable law.
The limitations and exclusions of liability set out in this Section and elsewhere in these terms of use: (a) are subject to the preceding paragraph; and (b) govern all liabilities arising under these terms of use or in relation to the subject matter of these terms of use, including liabilities arising in contract, in tort (including negligence) and for breach of statutory duty.

You hereby indemnify us and undertake to keep us indemnified against any losses, damages, costs, liabilities and expenses (including, without limitation, legal expenses and any amounts paid by us to a third party in settlement of a claim or dispute on the advice of our legal advisers) incurred or suffered by us arising out of any breach by you of any provision of these terms of use, or arising out of any claim that you have breached any provision of these terms of use.

Without prejudice to our other rights under these terms of use, if you breach these terms of use in any way, we may take such action as we deem appropriate to deal with the breach, including suspending your access to the website, prohibiting you from accessing the website, blocking computers using your IP address from accessing the website, contacting your internet service provider to request that they block your access to the website and/or bringing court proceedings against you.

Severability

Exclusion of third party rights

Meet Noor Jahan Begum: Your Independent Voice for Ilford South
Fed up with empty political promises? On July 4th, make your vote count for real change. Support Noor for Ilford South and let’s make a difference together.
My Priorities For Ilford South
- To support an immediate ceasefire and increase humanitarian aid for Palestine.
- To increase funding for the NHS and improve public services.
- To tackle the cost of living crisis and increase support for the vulnerable.
- To increase affordable housing and tackle homelessness.
- To reduce crime and improve policing in Redbridge.
Fresh Start for Ilford South
Tired of endless political promises without results? It’s time for real change.
I’m Noor Jahan Begum, and I am committed to working with residents to make Ilford South cleaner, greener, fairer, safer, and more prosperous.
As a local resident, mother of four, Commissioner of Health and Social Care, Magistrate, and community activist, I understand the issues that matter to you.
I am passionate about Gaza, anti-poverty initiatives, social justice, and improving public services. As your independent voice, I will listen to you and represent all residents.
Together, we can tackle inequality, the cost of living, the housing crisis, and rising crime. A vote for me is a vote for positive change.
Join me in building a brighter future for Ilford South.
Together, we can get things done!
Why I’m Running
Manifesto and Vision for Ilford South
Please refer to my manifesto and vision for Ilford South for more details.
